27e24f2d-f082-4260-9655-720058c2768c.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a fundamental working knowledge of front-end and back-end technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, MySQL, MongoDB, Express.js, and React.js. Additionally, Badge earners demonstrated their ability to work on teams with demanding deadlines to create full-stack web applications.
27e24f2d-f082-4260-9655-720058c2768c.name: Full Stack Coding Boot Camp

alignments.name: MERN
alignments.description: MERN stands for MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, Node.js, for the four key technologies that make up the stack. MongoDB - document database; Express.js - Node.js web framework; React.js - a client-side JavaScript framework; and Node.js - the premier JavaScript web server.

badge_template_activities.title: Learners must pass all programming assignments and exams during the boot camp.
A professional portfolio featuring three group projects and other web applications created during the boot camp.

b19d887c-25b4-400d-a468-0f9a9f720890.description: Earners of the Leader in Teaching Excellence badge have demonstrated a commitment to all seven competencies in the University College Teaching Excellence Program. Badge earners have achieved a gold status and demonstrated a knowledge of high impact, evidence-based online teaching practices in areas related to instructional delivery, inclusive teaching practices, grading and feedback, writing and formatting, student success, teaching adults, and educational technology.
b19d887c-25b4-400d-a468-0f9a9f720890.name: Leader in Teaching Excellence

alignments.name: OLC Online Teaching Certificate Program
alignments.description: The Online Learning Consortium's Online Teaching Certificate draws on the latest research regarding methods, tools, and best practices for teaching in an online or digital environment. Learners leverage their proficiencies as an educator, administrator, or institutional leader to become a more effective online teaching and learning professional.

alignments.name: OLC Mastery Series Program
alignments.description: The Online Learning Consortium's Mastery Series Program emphasizes the theory and application of research on key topics and culminates in a Recognition of Mastery in a topic. Each series allows learners to explore relevant research and use that research to help them design an effective teaching and learning environment.

alignments.name: OLC Quality Course Teaching and Instructional Practice Scorecard
alignments.description: Designed to evaluate the overall classroom experience, the Online Learning Consortium's Quality Course Teaching and Instructional Practice (QCTIP) scorecard can be used to evaluate teaching effectiveness in several areas, including: Course Fundamentals, Learning Foundations, Faculty Engagement, and Student Engagement.

alignments.name: Community of Inquiry Framework
alignments.description: The Community of Inquiry theoretical framework represents a process of creating a deep and meaningful (collaborative-constructivist) learning experience through the development of three interdependent elements – social, cognitive, and teaching presence.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend workshops in all seven competency areas and provide reflection on application to earn a gold award, which will include a digital badge and the moniker “Leader in Teaching Excellence.” Competency areas are: Instructional Delivery, Inclusive Teaching, Grading and Feedback, Writing and Formatting, Student Success, Teaching Adults, and Educational Technology.

c5bff31b-bf40-4794-84df-e1474a090415.description: Earners of the High Performance Leadership Program micro-credential have demonstrated competency in three areas: leadership, business acumen, and building teams. They have gained relevant, timely knowledge about leadership and business topics, they have improved their technical skills, and they have developed interpersonal skills relevant to a business setting. Earners of this micro-credential may also apply their leadership program towards the Family Business Leadership micro-credential.
c5bff31b-bf40-4794-84df-e1474a090415.name: High Performance Leadership Program

badge_template_activities.title: Leadership (40 hours) – students must complete one of the following leadership workshops: A) Denver Leadership Experience (admission requirement of seven-plus years of direct people-management experience); B) Accelerated Leadership Experience; C) Public Safety Leadership Development Program; or D) Custom leadership program offered by Daniels Executive Education in partnership with a business or organization that mirrors the same rigor and learning outcomes.

Business Acumen (40 hours) – students must complete 40 hours of instruction in business acumen workshops. Options include: 20 hour workshops; 10 hour workshops; or a custom 10-20 hour workshop offered by Executive Education in partnership with a business/organization mirroring the same rigor and learning outcomes. For a list of workshops, visit daniels.du.edu/executive-education.

Communication and Team Building (4 hours) – students must complete one of the following workshops: A) Effective Communication Using Insights Discovery; B) Building Teams & Organizations Using Insights Discovery; C) Custom workshop offered by Daniels Executive Education in partnership with a business or organization that mirrors the same rigor and learning outcomes.

ea58ae53-75b2-4c01-9d5a-80d7c21040c3.description: The Office of Teaching and Learning’s Teaching for Inclusion & Equity (TIE) Foundational badge program offers multifaceted professional development on inclusive and equitable teaching practices, including course design, relationship building and culturally responsive communication. As participants develop increased awareness of their biases and assumptions about students, they will be able to intervene in instances of racism, sexism, homophobia and other forms of oppression.
ea58ae53-75b2-4c01-9d5a-80d7c21040c3.name: Teaching for Inclusion & Equity

alignments.name: NADOHE Framework for Advancing Anti-Racism Strategy on Campus
alignments.description: PROVIDE TRAINING AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT to ensure faculty can review curricula, pedagogical practices, and the methodologies used to assess learning with an anti-racism lens. Additionally, provide opportunities to make substantive changes to course curricula and teaching practices, including engagement in culturally responsive instruction.

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the Faculty Institute for Inclusive Teaching, which is an asynchronous course offered in Cornerstone
Attendance of one of the following: Six Equity/UDL Your Course workshops, OR the annual Neurodiversity institute, OR participating in a faculty learning community offered by the ITP director
Completion of one community consultation with a DU staff member with DEI expertise
Three reflective assignments

de62e717-a6d6-4a24-a7be-74d1a55478ef.description: Earners of a Diversity and Inclusion micro-credential register to take three courses related to diversity, equity, inclusion, and related issues (e.g., stereotyping, prejudice, or discrimination) and can share an online portfolio that highlights their expertise and experiences relating to these issues. Students leave the program with greater knowledge and experience in a focused content area and can better articulate that knowledge and experience. Contact Daniel.Storage@du.edu to apply.
de62e717-a6d6-4a24-a7be-74d1a55478ef.name: Psychology: Diversity and Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully pass two pre-determined required courses and a third course to be selected from a menu of “optional” courses. The course requirement(s) can be completed at any time, and previously completed courses count. Note that all three courses must be credit-bearing undergraduate courses taken at the University of Denver.

Work with a faculty sponsor to complete an experiential project lasting one quarter. The experiential project will be tailored to you, your interests, and your faculty sponsor's ability to support you on it.

Develop an online portfolio that integrates what you learned in your coursework with what you did for your experiential project. This portfolio should be public facing (e.g., so you can link it on your resume or CV).
Communicate your expertise in the annual "Portfolio Showcase" and in mock interviews.

fbe29278-6587-4f1c-80f3-adc721b50502.description: Earners of this badge have completed the Denver Publishing Institute and gained an understanding of how books are published in trade, university press and higher education publishing. They have developed practical skills through homework assignments related to editing and marketing, as well as evaluated manuscripts and book proposals for acquisitions. This experience has prepared them to become highly effective contributors in a publishing organization.
fbe29278-6587-4f1c-80f3-adc721b50502.name: Denver Publishing Institute

badge_template_activities.title: Students will need to complete all assignments for the course. Assignments will include writing a readers report, two short grammar quizzes, line editing samples, market analysis exercises, writing a press release, developing a marketing plan for a book and developing a book idea targeted to an independent publisher.
Attend class either in-person or virtually.

58dbdf70-527d-4379-885b-b47826aeb0f6.description: Participants who complete the Family Business Leadership Program gain valuable knowledge and skills in the areas of leadership, general business (data, finance/accounting, marketing and sales), and family business. As a result, they have the ability to advance their family businesses, helping it reach multi-generational success. Earners of this micro-credential may also apply their leadership program towards the High Performance Leadership micro-credential.
58dbdf70-527d-4379-885b-b47826aeb0f6.name: Family Business Leadership Program

badge_template_activities.title: Leadership (40 hours) – students must complete one of the following leadership workshops: A) Denver Leadership Experience (admission requirement of seven-plus years of direct people-management experience); B) Accelerated Leadership Experience; C) Public Safety Leadership Development Program; or D) Custom leadership program offered by Daniels Executive Education in partnership with a business or organization that mirrors the same rigor and learning outcomes.

Business and Family Business Acumen (40 hours) – students must complete 40 hours of instruction in business acumen workshops offered through Executive Education and/or the Bailey Program for Family Enterprise. At least 20 of these hours must be completed through family business-specific workshops. For a list of workshops, visit daniels.du.edu/executive-education.

8d057af2-beab-4243-a805-ee2fde542949.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a foundational level of competence in carrying out professional communication tasks in French, both oral and written, in the specific context of international relations. Learners will be able to describe global issues with Francophone colleagues in social and professional contexts.
8d057af2-beab-4243-a805-ee2fde542949.name: French for International Relations 1

alignments.name: ACTFL
alignments.description: Linguistically, the French for International Relations 1 badge references the American Council on the Teaching of Foreign Languages (ACTFL) scale to assess the level of proficiency.

alignments.name: CEFR
alignments.description: Linguistically, the French for International Relations 1 badge references the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR) descriptors to assess level.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete all assignments in the course
Develop an online portfolio that integrates tasks completed in French during the course to research a country of your interest
Give an oral presentation in French on a contemporary issue in another country and make recommendations

56a4c713-e9b1-42a5-a622-e42ae31d42d7.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an intermediate level of competence in carrying out professional communication tasks in French, both oral and written, in the specific context of international relations. Learners will be able to share their perspectives on global issues to engage their Francophone colleagues.
56a4c713-e9b1-42a5-a622-e42ae31d42d7.name: French for International Relations 2

alignments.name: ACTFL
alignments.description: Linguistically, the French for International Relations 2 badge references the American Council on the Teaching of Foreign Languages (ACTFL) scale to assess the level of proficiency.

alignments.name: CEFR
alignments.description: Linguistically, the French for International Relations 2 badge references the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR) descriptors to assess level.

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete all assignments in the course
Develop an online portfolio that integrates tasks completed in French during the course to research a global issue of your interest
Give an oral presentation in French to express and defend a point of view about a global issue and make recommendations

864c04f0-3ce5-403d-85a7-546c1f35dcc4.description: Earners of a Data-informed Decisions micro-credential register to take three courses to build their data analytic skills, including the ability to analyze datasets with statistical software (e.g., SPSS, JASP, R) and the ability to make applicable decisions or conclusions based on real data. Some students may also engage in projects that allow them to become better acquainted with the research process, for example by proposing or conducting a study. Contact Daniel.Storage@du.edu to apply.
864c04f0-3ce5-403d-85a7-546c1f35dcc4.name: Psychology: Data-informed Decisions

4f89833f-114d-4276-9c58-c8bdb7e1dddf.description: Earners of a Mental Health micro-credential register to take three courses related to clinical work in psychology, often including specific knowledge about certain psychological disorders (e.g., anxiety disorders, mood disorders, childhood disorders). Some students may engage in an applied experience (e.g., an internship), whereas others may engage in theoretical work (e.g., a literature review on a specific disorder’s etiology or presentation). Contact Daniel.Storage@du.edu to apply.
4f89833f-114d-4276-9c58-c8bdb7e1dddf.name: Psychology: Mental Health

2916b580-500f-41a9-abae-84322a97c15b.description: Students who complete the Student Employees Achieve (SEA) badge will be proficient in application of the NACE career readiness competencies in their student employment role and prepared to transfer those skills to post-graduate work opportunities. This process of reflection, connection, and discovery delivers on the 4D Experience, providing opportunities that support students’ intellectual growth, character growth, well-being, and sense of purpose.
2916b580-500f-41a9-abae-84322a97c15b.name: Student Employees Achieve

alignments.name: NACE Career Competencies
alignments.description: National Association of Colleges and Employers (NACE)'s Career Readiness Competencies

badge_template_activities.title: Complete an appointment with a Career Advisor or Career Peer Advisor and complete reflection questions (Career & Self-Development competency)
Complete the interactive New Student Employee Orientation in Canvas

Attend training (synchronous or asynchronous) in the six NACE Career Readiness Competencies below, and complete reflection questions about application of the skill to your current and future job(s): Communication, Critical Thinking, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Teamwork, Technology

Complete a written, video, audio, or other format 4D reflection on the student employee's professional identity, what has informed it, and what that means for a future career (Professionalism competency)

597f9bb5-d426-4ac8-949a-cdcbbdc19c06.description: The Office of Teaching and Learning’s Teaching for Inclusion & Equity (TIE) Intermediate badge offers multifaceted professional development on inclusive and equitable teaching practices, including course design, relationship building and culturally responsive communication. As participants develop increased awareness of the impact of their teaching practices in the classroom through careful data collection, they will be able to discuss and address equity gaps in their discipline.

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance of two OTL workshops offered only to TIE Intermediate badge program participants focused on inclusive teaching principles, scholarship of teaching and learning, and project design

Completion of three community consultations with the following OTL Directors: the Director of Assessment, the Director of Inclusive Teaching Practices and the Director of Scholarship of Teaching & Learning and Faculty Learning Communities
Design and completion of a project that addresses a social justice issue in the classroom
Presentation of project results to a DU audience
Completion of project proposal and project artifact
